channel.title: Vitali Plagov Blog
channel.description: Recent content on Vitali Plagov Blog

item.title: How to configure Renovate for multiple repositories On Azure DevOps
item.description: I had an opportunity to integrate the Renovate bot into our project. I would like to share my experience on how to configure Renovate for multiple repositories on Azure DevOps platform.

item.title: How I learned about the rule engine pattern with Java
item.description: In this blog post, I would like to describe how I learned about the rule engine pattern while contributing to the open-source project.

item.title: Project Euler: Solving problem 9 - Pythagorean triplet
item.description: The problem 9 of the Project Euler is about a Pythagorean triplet. It’s a good problem as it gives a chance to practice implementing mathematical formulae with the Java code.

item.title: Project Euler: Solving problem 8
item.description: Project Euler is a website with hundreds of mathematical and algorithmic problems. Some time ago I started solving those issues using Java. My goal is to practice general programing and algorithmic skills using the latest version of Java. So, in this blog post, I will shortly describe the solution to problem 8.

item.title: Load Testing With Gatling
item.description: In the previous blog post I’ve described how to use Dataprovider of TestNG to assert the response time of the REST API endpoint when sending multiple parallel requests. In this blog post, I will describe how to do the same with Gatling, which is a more suitable tool for such kind of task.

item.title: Running Multiple Parallel Requests With RestAssured and TestNG
item.description: RestAssured can be used not only for sending HTTP requests and asserting response body and headers. It also can measure the response time and assert it against a condition you set. In this blog post, I describe the way how to send multiple parallel requests with RestAssured and a data provider from TestNG.

item.title: Installing SaltStack Within a Vagrant Environment
item.description: In this blog post, I will describe how to install and use SaltStack in an isolated and safe Vagrant environment. This can be useful to get familiar with SaltStack and try its features.
